topic.description: The name of the Kafka topic used as dead letter queue
topic.title: Dead Letter Topic Name

kafka_topic.description: Comma separated list of Kafka topic names
kafka_topic.title: Topic Names

mongodb_collection.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB collection to bind to this endpoint.
mongodb_collection.title: MongoDB Collection

mongodb_database.description: Sets the name of the MongoDB database to target.
mongodb_database.title: MongoDB Database

mongodb_hosts.description: Comma separated list of MongoDB Host Addresses in host:port format.
mongodb_hosts.title: MongoDB Hosts

oneOf.description: An opaque reference to the mongodb_password

mongodb_persistent_tail_tracking.description: Enable persistent tail tracking, which is a mechanism to keep track of the last consumed message across system restarts. The next time the system is up, the endpoint will recover the cursor from the point where it last stopped slurping records.
mongodb_persistent_tail_tracking.title: MongoDB Persistent Tail Tracking

mongodb_tail_track_increasing_field.description: Correlation field in the incoming record which is of increasing nature and will be used to position the tailing cursor every time it is generated.
mongodb_tail_track_increasing_field.title: MongoDB Tail Track Increasing Field

mongodb_username.description: Username for accessing MongoDB. The username must be present in the MongoDB's authentication database (authenticationDatabase). By default, the MongoDB authenticationDatabase is 'admin'.
mongodb_username.title: MongoDB Username
